task_summary: PR2 detects the fridge door, approaches and grasps the handle, pulls to open the hinged door, verifies it is open, and retreats.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2 robot operates in a cluttered office/kitchen area to open a small refrigerator. The robot must visually locate the fridge door and handle, approach while keeping clearance from nearby drawers and obstacles, orient its wrist for a pulling motion, grasp the handle, and pull the hinged door open. Once the door swings wide and the interior is visible, the robot verifies the door state and retreats to a safe viewing pose. Timing and forces are moderate; precision alignment around the handle is important to avoid slipping or scraping.
preconditions: Fridge is reachable by the PR2 arm
Door is unlocked and free to swing
Robot base is stable and gripper functional
stepwise_plan: Detect the fridge door and handle region
Open gripper and move toward the handle
Set wrist yaw for a lateral pull and close gripper
Execute door opening on hinged door
success_criteria: No collisions with drawers or cabinet
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails: re-detect and slightly adjust viewpoint
If alignment/grasp slips: reopen gripper, re-approach, and re-grasp
If door sticks: retry opening after adjusting yaw and approach
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after ContainerOpen is true and a retreat to the nominal viewing pose is completed.

frame_3.now_evidence: End-effector at the handle with imminent/ongoing grasp; alignment cues visible.
frame_3.predicts_next: Pull/open action should follow as the door begins to swing.

node_specs.description: Visual detection of the fridge door region.
Prepare gripper for grasping the handle.
Orient wrist to pull the hinged door.
Pull to open the hinged fridge door.
Back off to a safe viewing pose.

failure_modes: Door/handle not detected due to lighting or pose
Door hinge friction too high for initial pull
recovery_strategy: Re-run DetectObject from slightly offset pose
Adjust wrist yaw and repeat OpenContainer
Reduce approach distance and try alternative angle
assumptions: The fridge door is a right-hinged door with an accessible handle as seen in frames.
The robot can safely pull without moving the base.
If the instruction implied a different mechanism, frames take precedence.

expected_success_criteria: Robot ends in a non-colliding pose
